data.event: The Republic of Liberia, beginning as a settlement of the American Colonization Society (ACS), declared its independence on July 26, 1847.

event.title: did not recognize Liberia's independence until during the American Civil War on February 5, 1862

data.event: The United States did not recognize Liberia's independence until during the American Civil War on February 5, 1862.

data.event: Between January 7, 1822 and the American Civil War, more than 15,000 freed and free-born Black Americans from United States and 3,198 Afro-Caribbeans relocated to the settlement.

event.title: January 3, 1848 Joseph Jenkins Roberts, a wealthy free-born Black American from Virginia who settled

data.event: In January 3, 1848 Joseph Jenkins Roberts, a wealthy free-born Black American from Virginia who settled in Liberia, was elected as Liberia's first president after the people proclaimed independence.
